definition: erhua variant of 差一點|差一点[cha4 yi1 dian3]
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: On the quiz, my son was a bit weak on history.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子的历史成绩在测试中稍差一点儿。

sentences.english: I just avoided running over the cat.
Of course, then you were nearly crushed to death in front of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那天，就在我的眼皮底下你差一点儿被车轧死。

sentences.english: The boy was nearly run over by a car.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩差一点儿被汽车轧了。

sentences.english: I'm used to high quality and won't take second-best.
sentences.chinese: 我用惯高质量的东西，差一点儿的都不行。

sentences.english: The kid almost fell off the bed.
sentences.chinese: 那个小孩差一点儿从床上跌下来。

sentences.english: Poor kid, just lack one point to gett full score.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的孩子，差一点儿满分了。

sentences.english: which nearly got the Footlight Prize this year.
sentences.chinese: 它今年差一点儿得了最佳舞台奖。

sentences.english: I nearly forget that I promised to take you to Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 我差一点儿忘了我曾答应过要带你去上海的。

sentences.english: At the on the road that go to work, he bumped the person almost.
sentences.chinese: 在上班的路上，他差一点儿撞了人。

sentences.english: Dreams of finding lost treasure almost came true recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近，找到失踌宝旅的梦想差一点儿变成现实。

definition: erhua variant of 差點|差点[cha4 dian3]
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
to cause or lead to sth bad
if it were not for/but for
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
